column4: hey my xchat cannot accept files (I think, problem could be on the senders end) -- I click accept and then it is stuck in connnect state forever
any ideas why i can't accept files via xchat?
is there an option to block them?
i don't understand
the other guy tries to send, i get a popup, click accept, nothing happens
is there a setting in xchat someplace to block all file transfers (for security)
ill check
in the changelog it satates "Added "Auto accept file offers" to the File Transfer settings"
tried that still not working
maybe it needs restarting to apply
thanx lemme try that
im not understanding the output; but i dont see any ports
when i do netstat -anp | grep 8443 i see that a process is listening on that port
i dont understand
right, i did not see that after -a
ok, im new at this so you can explain it like you would to an idiot? ;)
true but the rfc standard says port 22. If you change it in /etc/ssh/sshd_config it will show a port number
how would i determine the difference between port 22 is available, but a process is not using it?
http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/qQP1hM86 and thanx
no, rictotz should be ricotz -- my bad sorry
yep thanx
run:   man tar
yeah i just saw that
